name: Collecting Society of Hungarian Creative Artists Association Hungart
goal: HUNGART was founded in 1997 and represents a little more than 900 Hungarian creators and copyright owners of fine & applied art work and photography. Its main goals are to represent the interests and rights of the visual artists as well as to perform the collective management related activities. As a CISAC member HUNGART also actively cooperates with the biggest European and American collective management societies in the field of visual art relating to collection of royalties and providing professional support to each other.
interests: Competition, Consumer Affairs, Culture, Economic and Financial Affairs, Education, Information Society, Internal Market, Justice and Fundamental Rights
euInitiatives:
- the exploitation of orphan works by public cultural institutions
- Panorama-exception (including Wikipedia's current strategy relating to Freedom of Panorama)
- negotiations of agreements and/or enforcement of rights against social media and sharing platforms
- competition complaint against Google Image Search
